"Students at Zhejiang University's academic conference sing the main theme song, research results impressing people's minds - Xinhua Net"

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

"Using air to wash hands, diagnose diseases by blowing air, and precisely searching for the source of haze. Yesterday evening, at the academic conference of Zhejiang University in 2016, a series of groundbreaking academic achievements were awarded."

These results are mainly researched by students, covering various fields such as environmental science, mechanical engineering, energy, medicine, life sciences, and humanities. Starting from a mere curiosity, they have created many practical and high-end inventions, some of which have won domestic and international awards.
Biological sensor: Your family doctor for home health check.
The Zhang Dingming team from the Biomedical Engineering Department of the Academy of Military Medical Sciences demonstrated a smartphone-sized biological sensor at the scene.
"You just need to blow into this device lightly, and it can detect your body's health condition from the air you exhale."
Zhang Dingming introduced, this sensor is connected to a smartphone, and after taking a deep breath, the health report will be displayed on the phone.
Smart rings on the market can detect health conditions by measuring physical parameters such as temperature and pulse.

The sensor utilized a new type of material, graphene, which has a target of detecting chemical elements, and its sharp "olfactory" ability allows it to more accurately and deeply express the body's health status.
Smart surgical light: Surgeons' high-powered eyes.
Besides smartphones, the operating room also uses smart surgical lights.
This invention won the silver award at the 44th Geneva International Invention Exhibition this year.

Master's students Zhu Lin and Shen Junfei from the Department of Optoelectronics and Electrical Engineering have opened up new ideas in the defects of traditional surgical lamps and invented an intelligent LED surgical lamp with no shadows.
"Many diseases' early detection and removal are not in place, and there is a connection between the light used in the surgeon's operating room and these diseases."
Shen Jun said, for example, during early cancer screening, if the doctor cannot clearly see all the tumor tissues in a timely manner, then the cancer cells will continue to spread afterward.
This intelligent surgical lamp has four light panels, which adjust the light spectrum to enhance the differences between different tissues under illumination.
During surgery, the doctor can adjust the size, brightness, spectrum, color balance, and transparency of the light based on the surgical needs and personal habits, at any time.

This intelligent surgical light has been used in Zhejiang University Medical School Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine Affiliated Children's Hospital, and other hospitals for trial, and has received good feedback.
Last year in October, this invention won the National Innovation Award for the first prize.
"Use air to wash your hands: saves water and cool"
Ordinary people wash their hands with water and soap, rub their hands with soap, and use hand sanitizer, while Li Xiaochang and his classmates invented an "air-powered hand-washing device".
As long as we stand on the air compression platform, our weight can compress the air.
"Just like a pressure cooker."
The compressed air forms a fluid at the water dragon's mouth and combines with water.
"So, let's wash our hands clean!"
The results of the color reaction and bacterial residue experiments demonstrate that the effectiveness of hand-washing using this method is the same as that of conventional hand-washing methods.

This device only needs to rely on our own gravity as a driving force, ensuring both cleanliness and water conservation, with no energy waste throughout the entire process, making it energy-saving and environmentally friendly.
Last year, at the second global grand challenge summit, this invention emerged from among many top universities and won the only gold award.

This is the critical moment.
If I were to suffer from heart disease, brain hemorrhage, or stop breathing, then our window of life has only four minutes, the golden four minutes!
So, the people around you understand how important first aid is!
When someone near us falls, we can provide professional rescue through our knowledge, rather than standing there uselessly and unable to do anything, which is too terrifying.
In China, our official data shows that there are 300 million people who die annually due to accidents, with the most dangerous being cardiac arrest.
In the United States, approximately 15% of people can be saved.
In the casino hotels of Las Vegas, 70% of the guests can be saved, while in Shanghai and Beijing, the percentage is below 1%.
This is what the first reactionary founder, Lu Le, said.
If a person experiences cardiac arrest, breathing and pulse are absent, and CPR has no effect.
Must perform artificial respiration and chest compressions to possibly save the person.

I discover that many people nowadays lack the awareness to learn emergency first aid, but when an accident happens, it's too late to learn, so I appeal to everyone to learn this skill so that we can respond promptly when faced with an emergency situation.

You can sign up for first aid certification at your local Red Cross training center, and I have signed up for it at the Red Cross training center in Zhuhai. Additionally, there are discounts available for students.

"First, I conclude that the movie 'Four Seas' is a complete disaster from all aspects. "
But you have to say that this movie is not without its highlights, and the soundtrack is also not bad.

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

"There are many ways to enjoy a movie, such as falling asleep in the theater or feeling angry after watching it. 'The Four Seas' is like a monkey on Mount Emei, using various methods to ignite your anger."

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

"In terms of insulting the audience, Hong Luo is truly a natural talent."

This part of the movie is the most painful because it's as if it's a creation from the novel "Crime and Punishment" by Dostoevsky, with too many holes and imperfections, much like a tattered cloak on Little Hiao's body.
You may even doubt whether there is a hidden implication from the director after watching it, but upon careful consideration, you will find that it is just a load of nonsense.
It's simple, I find it hard to understand some situations.
The male protagonist should reside in a small island located in the southern part of the sea, and his grandmother depends on him for everything.
She grandma has a wish to see the snow, and then the neighbors arranged for an old man to take her in his small bread car to the northeast to see the snow.
An old man sitting in a bicycle from the south to the northeast to see snow?
They are both very relaxed about it.
Then the old man just disappeared.
How did the female owner of the hotel on the abandoned ship get her business license?
Why could the little hooligans on the island easily block a section of mountain road with their toy cars?
Then the truck carrying steel bars stopped at the side of the road and the drivers of the surrounding trucks couldn't find it.
This is too obvious.
Why would a small-time criminal with a bad reputation and criminal charges become a police aid?
Why didn't he report the high-interest loan to the police? In the movie, the police even specifically asked if he had any difficulties.
A grown adult doesn't know how to use the hotel room key card after arriving at the hotel, and then arranges to find the hotel manager without success, ends up sleeping outside the room door?
This bizarre and absurd sequence is filled throughout the entire film, and because the events are too out of place, even recalling them now can make me feel painful.
Besides the plot, the worst part is that the movie lacks a clear theme or even has no theme at all, it's just a mess of a film.

At the beginning of the movie, you might think he's making a comedy, but 20 minutes later, you might realize it's actually a motivational film. Watching half of it makes you think it might be a drama about the difficulties of growing up in a small town, and after watching the whole thing, you have no idea what kind of movie it is. As a result, you start to doubt yourself deeply, wondering why you went to the movie theater to watch something so confusing.

For most people, it's actually quite familiar with various movie clichés, such as how to portray a motorcycle stuntman, which could involve inspiring and comedic elements, and then tell the audience a step-by-step account of how a talented bird can achieve success.
If you want to make a romantic comedy, then you should focus on the love story between the young man from the small town and the waitress.
If you want to reflect reality, then at least your scene cannot contain things that are inconsistent with the normal world.
(For example, like the new motorcycle that Zhang Yi was riding, which was then able to sing after being burned, but couldn't resist the brain holes that were opened after seeing Kenny's.)
The female lead is not just acting like a 5-year-old child in some aspects, I really don't know if it's due to her acting skills or the director's requirements.
I also find it a bit puzzling why Han Tian, as a race car driver, is so eager to include a crash scene in his own movie.
Is this movie schedule during the Spring Festival season just to torture the audience?

Check the inspection and processing equipment for concrete block modules: Introduction to the equipment in Zhengzhou:

Zhengzhou Yiheng is a domestic manufacturer of inspection modules for concrete testing, inspection machine equipment, and wall body modules for concrete testing machines. They specialize in producing semi-automatic to fully automatic production lines.
Through years of practice and development, we now have a range of quality products, including hydraulic, mobile, and fully automated inspection well equipment and accompanying devices.
Check the inspection and processing equipment for the production of concrete blocks in the following locations:

Check the inspection and processing equipment for concrete mold modules and brick-making machines in Zhengzhou:

特点 (特 Points)

* 高效 (Efficient)
* 可靠 (Reliable)
* 多功能 (Multifunctional)
* 精准 (Accurate)

优势 (Advantages)

* 快速 (Fast)
* 可靠 (Reliable)
* 低成本 (Low Cost)
* 高质量 (High Quality)

The new type of construction material for underground infrastructure in cities, such as coal, heat, water, electricity, and gas, is widely used in the inspection and maintenance of underground pipes and equipment.
Inspection of various types of drains, water storage facilities, such as wells, rainwater drains, gutters, sewage tanks, and small construction structures, as well as bridge abutments and wing walls.

The advantage of using precast concrete modules to build inspection wells is that the modules have a hollow structure with grooves on the upper, lower, left, and right sides, which are combined to form a chain-like structure.
The brick-like masonry has better anti-cutting strength than the flat masonry construction form.

The module is a hollow structure, composed of vertically and horizontally interconnected pores, which are filled with reinforced concrete after being molded. After the concrete is poured, it forms a reinforced concrete net-like structure that provides secondary strengthening and waterproofing effects.
Modules in both directions have grooves, and the horizontal grooves and vertical grooves correspondingly improve the overall strength of the structure.

The use of reinforced concrete inspection wells and drainage wells is not prone to collapse, subsidence, or water leakage due to their modular design and mechanical performance. The wall body module is easy to operate and has standardized dimensions.

The intelligent control system for concrete inspection modules includes data input and output devices, touch-screen display, and mechanical operation monitoring, allowing for seamless communication between humans and machines, automatic analysis of comparison data, density control, safety logic control, and fault diagnosis systems.
The water pressure system in the wall uses single-stage pumping and transmission, while the double-stage pumping and transmission system is used.
Independent liquid pressure integration station, avoiding the impact of mainframe vibration on the liquid pressure system, thereby ensuring the reliability of the liquid pressure system.

The equipment for the inspection of concrete mixing station includes:

* Checking the concrete mixing box module with a pneumatic system to complete the unloading of the materials
* Closing the feeding box door and automatically sending the mold plate
* All of these operations are completed independently by the hydraulic system, thereby reducing the wear and tear on the mechanical equipment.
The concrete testing module of the inspection well drilling equipment uses imported computers, electrical appliances, seals, and pressure vessels, and has comprehensive and reliable performance.
The platform adopts an integrated steel plate, with no welding points at the cutting edges of the platform, allowing the filler box to move freely and reduce mechanical wear.
To reduce the burden of the mold, fill the mold with a combination of two materials, and use a synchronized, whole-body vibration system to ensure effective vibration.

The mechanical vibration system, which includes a hydraulic exciter and a computer-controlled vibration adjustment system based on the material price ratio, ensures no wear and tear, thereby prolonging the service life and reducing costs.
The wall-mounted water tank has both automatic and manual control functions.

Yesterday, the journalist learned from the City Education Bureau that this year, our city will launch a pilot program of "Modern Apprenticeship" talent training mode in 60 vocational schools, where students who are accepted into the program will simultaneously have the status of apprentices, and after being hired by the pilot enterprises, they will be trained and employed.

The municipal education bureau requires that vocational schools and enterprises standardize the recruitment and selection of students, clearly defining the dual identity of vocational school students and enterprise trainees, and adopting a mutual selection principle. The students, schools, and enterprises shall sign a tripartite agreement, and for students aged 16 or under, the agreement must be signed by the students, guardians, schools, and enterprises, determining the rights and interests of each party and the specific job training content, curriculum, and guarantees for the students.
Encourage trial schools to adopt modern apprenticeship forms and cooperate with enterprises to launch pre-job training and on-the-job training for employees.
Trial schools should reform their talent training mode.

Jointly designed talent training plan by the school and enterprises, formulated professional teaching standards, course standards, job standards, enterprise teacher standards, quality control standards, and implementation plans.

Trial period to train students as a pilot, and the practical training time of students in the enterprise is determined according to the professional talent training plan, and the internship period is generally 6 months.

In the practical implementation of enterprise training, the enterprise-based training mode should be implemented, according to the characteristics of different professions, one mentor can lead 2-5 apprentices to form a learning group, ensuring that students thoroughly master the skills required for each rotation.

According to the arrangement, from 2016 to August 2019, our city determined 60 city-level modern vocational practice trial sites, with each trial site having around 50 people, and a total of training around 3,000 students (practitioners).

According to the principle of gradually expanding from pilot testing to large-scale implementation, from point to surface-level integration, we will explore the establishment of a comprehensive talent training mechanism that combines school and enterprise collaboration, joint training, and whole-process cultivation, with the aim of significantly improving students' practical skills and employment outcomes.

South African doctor: Although the influenza virus (OMICRON) has strong transmission power, it is mostly mild.
Many South African doctors and health experts believe that the new coronavirus variant Omicron is less severe than the Delta variant, although it spreads faster.

According to a report by Xinhua News Agency, with the spread of the omicron variant in South Africa, a group of over 5,000 doctors in the province of Gauteng have reported that the symptoms of patients they are currently treating with COVID-19 are relatively mild, such as body aches and coughing, which are similar to those of a common cold.
Dr. Unben Pillay, the head of the organization, said that he sees dozens of patients every day, but none of them need to be hospitalized.
"Pei said, 'They can control their illness at home and most people recover within 10 to 14 days of isolation.'"
He said, including the elderly and those with underlying health issues, these groups of people are more prone to severe illness due to the coronavirus.
He said, compared to the previous wave of Delta epidemic, the new coronavirus patients he treated had "difficulty breathing and low oxygen levels."
Many people will need to be hospitalized for several days.
Two weeks after the first report of the new strain of Ebola in the southern part of Africa, other doctors shared similar experiences.
Although we have collected enough data to take several weeks, but the doctor's observation and early clues provided some leads.

According to the National Institute for Infectious Diseases and Blood Disorders in South Africa, in recent weeks, only 30% of COVID-19 patients hospitalized in South Africa were severe cases, which is half the proportion of severe cases in the previous wave; the average hospitalization time has been shortened from 8 days to 2.8 days; and currently, only 3% of patients have died, while in the early stages of the outbreak in South Africa, the death rate was 20%.

"Currently, almost all signs indicate that it is a mild disease," said Willem Hanekom, Director of the African Health Research Institute, citing data from the National Institute of Communicable Diseases and other reports.
He also said: "It's still early days, we need to collect post-data."
In normal circumstances, the time between hospitalization and death occurs later, but in this current wave of the epidemic, we only have two weeks.
At the same time, scientists around the world are observing the number of cases and hospitalization rates, while testing the effectiveness of current vaccines and treatments.
Although Delta is still the main new coronavirus strain worldwide, Omicrox cases are emerging in several countries, with South Africa serving as the epicenter of the outbreak.

According to the health official's introduction, the number of new cases discovered in the province during the first week of December increased by 400%, and the test results showed that the Omicron variant accounted for over 90% of the cases.

"Educational evaluation: What does it take to rescue kidnapped children?"

If the public service announcement similar to "There is no buying or selling without harm" is used, then in the absence of the need for "rehoming", good environmental conditions will lead to community policing, whole-of-society anti-trafficking, and making illegal activities without profit, risky, and costly. As a result, such crimes will not occur repeatedly.
Recently, the public security bureau's criminal investigation department has launched an urgent platform for missing children's information.
This is the authorized channel for releasing information on missing children and the internet platform created for timely recovery of abducted children.
The app name is "Circle" and I feel warm and fuzzy inside.
The new technological means are not only named "cultural" and full of emotion, but also informationized and practical, efficient and effective.
The first priority of the rescue operation is to locate and retrieve the abducted child, ensuring their safety and freedom.
The second is the trial and punishment of the accused.

The meaning of criminal punishment can be summarized as follows:

1. Individual punishment: to punish the offender and make them pay for their crimes.
2. Social prevention: to prevent crime by addressing the root causes of criminal behavior and creating a safer society.
3. Legal education: to educate the public about the law and their rights and responsibilities, in order to promote a culture of compliance with the law.
However, before the case of the sale is exposed, it is essential to prioritize the safety of the victim.

The weight of the matter is light, and under the urgent goal of "rescue," topics such as "should child trafficking be executed without exception" and other heated debates can be temporarily put on hold and discussed with caution, but the matter of rescuing kidnapped children should not be delayed.
Based on the experience of handling similar cases, the kidnapper is accustomed to quickly leaving the crime scene after the abduction.
Delaying the search for even a minute can make the child move further away from the parents, and the difficulty of solving the case will also increase by a minute.
In this situation, using platforms like "团圆" (túndiǎn) directly helps to crack the case and find the children, which is a practical and effective action.
Ultimately, "tackling" (i.e. dealing with) the issue of human trafficking requires the entire legal system to work together to do this big task.

Combating crime, protecting children and parental rights, from the improvement of laws to the guarantee of justice, and from the strict enforcement of the law to the thorough implementation of "protecting the weak," nothing is lacking.
Besides, the prevention of child trafficking can be improved from the family to the society level.
An example is a common case, a family of three at the train station taking a break, the parents fall asleep, and when they wake up, they find that their child is missing.
You cannot expect a two-year-old child to have sufficient self-protection skills, but as a parent of a young child, you should at least have a corresponding level of protective awareness.
Parents take turns resting, or placing their child in a stable and secure environment, are the minimum measures to prevent child abduction.
From another perspective, the buyers of stolen children should also be investigated and punished by the police.
A single act of unlawful behavior is often just a small loop in a long chain.
According to the Chinese Criminal Law, the minimum sentence for child trafficking is 5 years, and in serious cases, it can be death penalty and confiscation of property.
The punishment for selling children is more severe, given the trend of "lightening punishment".
There are still many cases of human trafficking happening every year.
Clearly, some people's views on child-rearing have been influenced by their cultural background, resulting in a lack of legal awareness.
The legal education for this part of the population should be synchronized with their progress.
To effectively control and prevent street crimes, it cannot be solely relied upon for strict law enforcement by authorities.

If the "market" for illegal goods is extensive, the sellers will be eager to lure customers, constantly innovating their sales methods, creating a "cat-and-mouse" game with law enforcement, and the illegal trade will inevitably become entangled in a low-efficiency quagmire.
Therefore, eliminate after-effects, popularize legal knowledge, and also help to root out child trafficking and purchase crimes.

The International Olive Council classifies olive oil into two main types: virgin olive oil (Virgin Olive Oil) and refined olive oil (Lampante Olive Oil or Refined Olive Oil), with five grades.
Crude sesame oil, also known as virgin sesame oil, is obtained by directly mechanical pressing of fresh sesame seeds, followed by filtering and removing impurities.
According to the acidity level, it can be divided into three levels:
Extra Virgin Olive Oil (EVOO): the highest grade, highest quality olive oil, a pure natural product.
The flavor is exquisite, with a subtle and elegant floral aroma, and the acidity is no more than 1%.
Fine Virgin Olive Oil (优质初榨橄榄油): acidity slightly higher than 2%, but still pure and mild in flavor.
Ordinary Virgin Olive Oil: Mild flavor and aroma, acidity not exceeding 3.3%.
Refined palm oil refers to palm oil that has undergone refining and has a acidity level exceeding 3.3%, or it can be called "second-grade oil."
Refined sesame oil can be classified into two categories:

Extra Virgin Olive Oil (EVOO): A blend of refined olive oil and a certain proportion of cold-pressed olive oil, mixed to balance flavor and color, with an acidity level of 1.5% or less, with a light yellow transparent appearance.
Refined olive-pomace oil (精炼橄榄杂质油或橄榄果渣油): obtained through solvent extraction from olive pomace and then refined.
You should have noticed that the acidity of olive oil is a very important indicator.
It's like grapes used for making wine are like different types of grapes from different regions, which will produce different standards of olive oil.

The coastal area of ​​the land has the most suitable soil, climate, sunlight, air humidity, and rainfall conditions for oil palm growth.

"Democracy's peak has passed, Biden declares the fire of freedom will never be extinguished."

The "Summit for Democracy" hosted by US President Biden, with the participation of government leaders from 110 countries around the world, civil society organizations, and private sector representatives, concluded on Friday (December 10th).
Biden said in his closing remarks that the fire of freedom burns in every person's heart around the world and cannot be extinguished by any totalitarian regime forever.
He also expressed his plan to hold the second Global "Democracy Summit" next year.
Taiwanese government representative, Tang Wan-shan, and current Hong Kong democratic rights activist, Lau Kong-wah, also spoke at the conference on the second day.
Biden said: "We know that the work that lies ahead of us is immense."
But we also know that we can face the challenge, because as I said before, the peak of this mountain illustrates the fact that democracy is nowhere to be found.
"A totalitarian regime can never extinguish the spark of freedom in people's hearts forever, as it burns brightly in the hearts of people all over the world."
Biden also expressed the need for collective effort from the entire society to defend democracy.

He said, "As the leader of the government, it is our responsibility to listen to our citizens, fortify democracy, push for reforms, achieve transparent and accountable governance, and resist the buffeting and pressure of those who seek power at any cost, as well as those who are willing to sacrifice the public interest for their own selfish goals."

The theme of the "Democracy Summit" on the second day is defending human rights, consolidating democracy and resisting authoritarianism, as well as rejecting digital authoritarianism and affirming democratic values.
It just so happens that today is "International Human Rights Day".
In his opening speech on that day, the United Nations Secretary-General Guterres also stated that democracy is facing challenges globally, particularly from new digital technologies.
He said: "Now is the time to reiterate our shared values and stand firm on our democratic principles."

This requires deepening social dialogue, addressing unequal issues, combating corruption, updating social contracts, investing in quality education, and expanding opportunities for women and children.
This also requires firmly condemning all forms of nationalism, localism, and extremism, including the use of all tools provided by technological revolutions.

"Hong Kong democracy activist Lau Siu-lai delivered a pre-recorded speech at the peak, reminding attendees to continue paying attention to the human rights situation of ethnic minorities in Hong Kong and Xinjiang."
He said: "For a long time, the world has been subject to China's rapid rise, but no mechanism has been established to hold it accountable."
This is why political leaders and civil society leaders must work together.
We must utilize all the resources we possess to ensure that the revival of democracy is our top priority.
Ronald Reagan also called upon the free world to unite against the threat posed by China.

He said: "Maybe some of you are afraid of offending Xi Jinping, maybe some of you don't want to lose the Chinese market, maybe some of you haven't realized the threat that the Communist Party poses to our democratic values."
This is the reason for our failure.
This is also one of the reasons we must change.

Taiwan's Executive Yuan Minister Tang Wai-keung, during a roundtable discussion on "Combating Digital Authoritarianism and Affirming Democratic Values," released a video statement emphasizing that Taiwan stands at the forefront of resisting autocracy and tyranny.
He also shared how he gained experience in combating the new coronavirus through transparency and building trust through information.

He said: "During Taiwan's democratic rise, we have always stood at the forefront of the global fight against authoritarianism, and have played a leading role in promoting global freedom, democracy, and human rights."

During the epidemic period, various authoritarian governments have used public health and collective interests as a pretext to rationalize their infringement of human rights, and the global democratic trend has shown signs of receding.
"However, in Taiwan, we don't have to seal off the city to control the epidemic, and we don't have to take down false information without a fight."

At the same time as the second day of the "Democracy Summit" schedule, the US Treasury Department announced the implementation of sanctions against 15 individuals and 10 entities from China, North Korea, and other countries that have been determined to severely violate human rights, while imposing investment restrictions on a Chinese company that has been identified as using surveillance technology to assist in these violations.

"A girl in Hangzhou Martial Arts Square stood in front of a large wooden board with the words 'Human Target, 10 Yuan per Arrow' written on it."
Yesterday morning, a photo of a girl from Hangzhou being used as a "target" for a charity drive went viral on social media.

The photo shows a girl standing in front of a large wooden board in Hangzhou Wulin Square, with the words "Human Target, 10 Yuan per Arrow" written on it. It indicates that pedestrians can pay and use the bow and arrow to shoot the target after payment.
This behavior sparked heated discussions among netizens.

Last night, the spokesperson for the Hangzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau's City Division confirmed to reporters from the New York Times that the girl in question was indeed the one who had been actively raising funds for charity, but the behavior she exhibited was not worth commending. After being admonished, the girl had left the local police station the day before.
"Girl on the street 'arrow target' fundraising is criticized"

In the picture circulating online, a long-haired girl is seen standing in front of a large wooden board with the character "人肉靶子" (human target) written in black ink on it, along with her bank account and digital payment account information written on another wooden board placed next to her.
The picture sparked controversy after it was posted online.
Some netizens believe that this is a "desperate plea for attention" while others show sympathy.
"We discovered the situation around 10am on the 23rd when we were patrolling the area nearby the square, and by then, the crowd had already gathered significantly."

During the interview with local media near the scene of the accident, the police officers from the nearby water town stated that the girl involved in the incident had two names, both of whom were around 20 years old and dressed in a youthful and beautiful manner.

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text:

Among them, the girl who was being used as a "human target" was crying and begging passersby to play a game; while another girl was standing by the side, shouting that her friend's sister had been diagnosed with leukemia and needed urgent surgery, pleading with everyone for help.
"We have contacted the local police in Guizhou and found out that the girl was raising funds for her sister's white blood cell treatment."

Last night, the spokesperson for the Hangzhou Public Security Bureau's city branch told a reporter from the New York Times that the girl's name is Jingjie, and she is raising funds for her sister Jingya.
However, due to the remaining medical expenses of around 300,000 yuan, we were unable to come up with a good solution and had to resort to fundraising.

He said, throughout the process, two girls were used as targets, one was responsible for pulling the trigger, but did not participate in it, and no one was shot during the process, but someone was filming and taking pictures and uploaded them to Weibo.
After the police determined through the security department, the arrow used did not fall under the control category.
The person in question expressed that "they do not advocate for this kind of eye-balling fundraising method."
After being warned by the police, she has already left the police station.

The seemingly lighthearted article actually reveals the daily struggles of project managers, representing a lack of sincerity in their current project management work.
The personnel in charge of project management are gradually taking action to get themselves out of the difficulties they are facing in their work.

According to the "China Project Management Twenty Years Development Report (1999-2019)" (as of September 2019): The number of PMP® exam candidates in China is nearly 60 million, with over 42 million passing the exam, and around 30 million holding valid certifications, accounting for 31.2% of the global PMP® certification total.

Over the past 10 years, the number of PMP (Project Management Professional) certification holders has been increasing steadily, which suggests that more and more project managers are realizing that relying solely on past experience is no longer sufficient to manage projects effectively. The rapidly changing work environment requires us to learn and adapt, and to stand on the shoulders of scientific giants to explore new paths forward.
However, does earning a PMP certification guarantee that project management work will run smoothly?

Many beginners in project management express that through learning PMP/IPMP related courses, they can systematically grasp the ten key areas and five process groups of project management, but when it comes to actually working on project management tasks, they still feel confused and disoriented.

With the online course "Research and Development Project Manager Training" of China Summer Consulting, we are here.

This is an opportunity for the company to train project managers at a lower cost and with less investment, resulting in efficient operation results.

The course is not just taught by a team of experts from the center of excellence (formerly from Huawei's R&D management team), but also combines the latest project management theories and practical scenarios from renowned companies, providing in-depth and comprehensive professional explanations.

"Jieming Advocates Conscious Consumption Before 'Double 12' - Economic Observer"
The total amount of online payment transactions in China's "Double 11" shopping festival this year reached 1.77 trillion yuan, setting a new high compared to previous years.

The colorful and diverse red envelopes, which have once again captured people's attention with their live broadcasts and tempting promotions, have sparked a new wave of consumption frenzy among Chinese consumers. On one hand, this consumption boom has strengthened the Chinese people's purchasing power, while on the other hand, it has also led people to reflect on the impact of consumerism on society and the current consumerist trend.

Before the "Double 12" shopping festival, Jiexin Consumer Finance (hereinafter referred to as "Jiexin") issued a rational consumption advocacy, reminding the majority of users, especially young people, to establish good consumption habits and resist blind consumption and excessive consumption.

According to the "Consumer Financial Literacy Survey Report" released by the People's Bank of China this year, the national consumer financial literacy index was 66.81, which is an increase of 2.04 compared to 2019.

In general, the residents of our country have made better financial consumption performances, but there are significant differences in financial behaviors and skills, and further improvement in basic financial knowledge is needed.

Older people and young people have relatively lower financial literacy levels, and "one old and one young" will still be a focus of continuous attention in financial education; according to the "2019-2020 China Youth Consumption Report" released by Nielsen and the "China Youth Debt Situation Report" released by CCTV Finance, young people have great consumption potential, and credit consumption has become an important path for consumption upgrades, with 86.6% of young people using credit products, and nearly half of them do not have debt accumulation. Although young people generally show a rational consumption trend, there are still some excessive consumption and follower consumption behaviors, which can lead to significant financial pressure and debt risks, and even cause social problems. Financial institutions should bravely assume social responsibilities and take proactive steps to guide young people towards a correct financial direction.

As a licensed financial institution, Jiexin has always been committed to providing high-quality and personalized services to help the masses build a happy life, advocating for consumers to establish correct consumption habits and actively responding to regulatory calls, with practical actions to enhance the rational consumption awareness of young consumers in particular.

Over the past few years, Jietang has continuously targeted young audiences, including college students, with comprehensive and diversified financial knowledge promotion activities. Through collaborations with top domestic universities, it has launched various forms of innovation competitions, such as the "Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition for Young People", to subtly guide young consumers' consumption needs and help them establish a rational consumption mindset, as well as to help them accumulate wealth through reasonable spending.

On December 12th, Jiexin reminds all consumers to establish reasonable consumption habits and correct spending attitudes, resist blind consumption and excessive consumption, avoid falling into the trap of overspending and debt, and avoid affecting one's credit score and future financial life.
It is essential to make advance plans for consumption and pay back debts on time.
If delayed, overdue records will be recorded in the personal credit report, which may have a negative impact on future purchases such as cars and homes.

At the same time, when enjoying financial products and services, it is important to choose regular institutions and channels, and to check if the relevant organizations have the necessary operating qualifications.

In the future, Jietian will continue to rely on its mature and reliable financial system and continuously updated financial products to provide consumers with more tailored and diversified services, helping to continuously improve consumers' financial knowledge and help them develop a rational consumption habit of borrowing, thus becoming a reliable and long-term consumption financial partner for consumers.

Vietnamese People's News Network - Southeast Asia Cooperation Council faces common challenges.
The resting station of Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman of Saudi Arabia includes Oman, United Arab Emirates (UAE), Qatar, Bahrain, and Kuwait.

It is worth noting that this is the first visit by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia to Qatar since the Saudi-led Arab coalition imposed a ban on Qatar in 2017, leading to the Gulf diplomatic crisis.

In this crisis, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Bahrain, and Egypt have severed their diplomatic relations with Qatar and imposed a comprehensive embargo on it, accusing Qatar of supporting terrorist organizations and having close ties with Iran.
The tense international situation has severely affected the internal unity of the ASEAN region, and has had a negative impact on the economy of the affected countries.
Four Arab countries have blocked the land, sea, and air routes leading to Qatar.

This crisis was resolved only at the Gulf Cooperation Council summit in January 2021, where each Gulf country signed an agreement mediated by the United States and Kuwait towards "unity and stability".
Saudi Arabia reopened its border with Qatar.
Saudi Arabia and Egypt are currently working together to appoint a new ambassador to restore relations with Qatar.

The Gulf Arab countries have bridged their differences to restore relations with Qatar, which is necessary for the interests and stability of each country and the region as a whole, in response to common challenges.
During the Saudi Crown Prince's visit to Oman, both sides agreed to establish the first direct land route between the two countries.
The connection of the two countries with a length of 725 kilometers long channel will provide convenient conditions for the travel and integration of supply chains of both countries' citizens.
Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund (PIF) will invest $50 billion in Amman, and 13 memorandums of understanding worth $300 billion have been signed between the two countries' companies.

Saudi Crown Prince's visit to countries in the region coincides with negotiations on the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) between Iran and major countries of the world, which is seen as a deal that cannot be solved by the Arab countries due to the Iranian missile issue.
Each Gulf country has long seen Iran as a long-term "competitor" and views Iran's nuclear program as a "threat" to regional security.
Each coastal state believes that not resolving the missile issue with Iran and failing to take action to restrain Iran's activities in the region is a deficiency.
In the background of the failed negotiations between major countries and Iran on nuclear issues, Saudi Arabia and Iran held direct talks.
Its goal is to suppress the tense situation in the region.
This is one of the factors that contribute to the national economic growth of the Hong Kong Bay Area.
The upcoming Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) summit will be the first since some member countries resolved their dispute with Qatar.

This is an opportunity for the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) to reassess and make contributions to promote the unification of the Gulf countries through diplomatic means, while proposing various measures to enhance cooperation among member states to address common challenges and make a collective contribution to the stability and development of Gulf countries.

"Let the university spirit resonate with the spirit of the times - Xinhua Net"

The term "university spirit" refers to a series of academic concepts and values that a university has accumulated over a long period of time through its development, and it is the soul of the university.
From ancient times to the present, the spirit of great learning has been crucial for the development of politics, economics, culture, technology, and the progress of a nation.

From the birth of the first modern university in the world, universities have borne a unique mission different from other social organizations, and for Chinese universities, it emerged during the fall of national crisis, with its spirit being deeply influenced by traditional culture and the transformation of the times, advocating the values of "cultivating virtue and benefiting the world" and "nurturing talent for the nation's strength."

The current trend in higher education is towards informatization and internationalization, with increasing global competition in education, technology, and talent, and higher education as an important "supply-side" facing unprecedented opportunities and challenges in its structural reform.

Specifically, the proposal to promote the construction of world-class universities and world-class disciplines as outlined in the "Comprehensive Plan for Promoting the Construction of World-Class Universities and Disciplines" has not only shown China's determination and confidence in becoming a major country in higher education, but has also raised the bar higher for university development.

How to quickly climb to the forefront of the world in a short period of time, while still maintaining a certain gap in basic conditions, and accelerate the establishment of several world-class universities and a batch of world-class disciplines, achieving "bending over backwards" ?

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

Besides establishing a clear goal and path, a prestigious university should also play to its strengths in the following three areas:

1. Firstly, it should leverage its advantage of "late blooming" by continuously introducing outstanding academic talents from abroad, learning from the advanced experiences of world-renowned universities, and significantly improving its academic standards and operational quality.
2. Secondly, it should inherit and develop the excellent cultural heritage of China, which has been accumulated over 5,000 years, and promote the development of excellent traditional culture. By doing so, it can gather strength, create a brand, and enhance its image.
3. Finally, it should play to its advantage as a socialist country's institution by leveraging its institutional advantages, strengthening its goal-oriented drive, mobilizing collective consciousness, optimizing resource allocation, and providing a solid guarantee for the university's sustained acceleration towards the advanced level.

It is particularly important to recognize that building a world-class university cannot be achieved by a single institution alone, and each school must highlight its unique advantages and characteristics while playing to its strengths.
The educational characteristics must have both common Chinese features and unique goals, teaching methods, and resources.

Just regarding Zhejiang University, we emphasize three aspects in our education:

1. Fostering innovative and entrepreneurial talents: We create a comprehensive environment for integrated education and training, combining academic and industrial collaboration to cultivate innovative and entrepreneurial talents.
2. Highlighting interdisciplinary research strengths: We promote optimization and adjustment of the academic system, establishing a favorable environment for interdisciplinary research and development, and actively cultivating new interdisciplinary disciplines and distinctive research achievements.
3. Emphasizing academic system and social service: We deepen international cooperation and exchange, accelerating the formation of the Zhejiang University-industry-research cooperative system, and providing high-quality educational services to society.
During this process, particularly important is to always uphold the spirit of the university and make the university spirit resonate with the spirit of the times.

For Zhejiang University, the school motto "Seeking truth and innovation" is complemented by the shared values of "studying diligently, cultivating virtue, discerning clearly, and being practical" as well as "embracing the ocean and the river, seeking the truth, cultivating oneself, and contributing to the country." Together, these constitute the latest expression of the spirit of Zhejiang University.
This is the school's consistent adherence to correct educational direction, which ensures the accumulation of cultural height, concentration of spiritual strength, and rich connotations.

Here is the translation of the passage:

"Among them, '海纳江河' emphasizes the open and inclusive spirit, with the motto '天下英才为我所用' (the world's talents are for my use) reflecting the university's commitment to cultivating high-quality educators; '启真厚德' stresses the pursuit of truth and morality, highlighting the university's commitment to fostering students' moral character and ethical values; '开物前民' embodies the spirit of innovation and reform, encompassing both the pursuit of knowledge and the creation of new technologies, as well as the drive for social and economic development; '树我邦国' emphasizes the university's commitment to serving the nation and its people, with the motto '大学应当始终与民族命运同荣共辱' (the university should always share the glory and honor of the nation's destiny) reflecting the university's responsibility to contribute to the nation's development."
This series of spiritual and value pursuits is the soul of Zhejiang University's 120-year history.
"The wise listen to the silent, the bright see beyond the unformed."

China should further establish itself in the global landscape of Chinese-style socialist modernization by deeply grasping the historical mission and contemporary position of higher education, and accelerating the construction of world-class universities.

At the same time, we must uphold the humanities and independence, let the university spirit and the spirit of the times, as well as the national spirit, intermingle and stimulate each other, thus providing an endless source of energy for realizing the country's prosperity and the nation's revitalization, and achieving the common ideal of humanity.

Guangxi University students' entrepreneurship training duration can reach up to 5 years - Xinhua Net.

According to a recent report from Xinhua News Agency on May 19th (reporter Zhang Yue), it has been learned that starting from next semester, universities in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region will adopt flexible academic systems, expand the scope of student internships, and allow students to extend their study period by 2-5 years. The internship period can be regarded as practical education time.

To promote the enhancement of entrepreneurial abilities of university students, the education and social affairs departments in Guangxi have jointly established an entrepreneurship platform, built more off-campus practice teaching bases, university science and technology parks, university student entrepreneurship parks, and entrepreneurship incubation bases, providing external guarantees for students' entrepreneurship.

According to the requirements, by 2020, each university's innovation and entrepreneurship practice base should cover an area of at least 3,000 square meters for undergraduate schools and 2,000 square meters for vocational schools.

The government encourages top universities to establish a innovation and entrepreneurship education system, and prioritize supporting outstanding students who have demonstrated exceptional performance in practical innovation and entrepreneurship.

University teachers must spend at least two months on internship in industrial enterprises every two years to enhance their awareness and capabilities for innovative teaching and entrepreneurship education.

The autonomous region education department requires each university in Guangxi to deeply implement the plan for training college students in innovation and entrepreneurship, and strive to have every college student participate in an innovation and entrepreneurship training program during their school period.
The university should actively organize students to participate in various levels of innovation and entrepreneurship competitions, and provide financial support.

The Chinese-American community files complaint against Yale, Harvard, and other Ivy League universities for discriminating against applicants of Asian descent - Xinhua Net.

According to Xinhua news on May 23rd, 130 Chinese-American organizations in the United States submitted a petition to the US Education and Justice Departments on the 23rd, protesting that three Ivy League universities - Yale University, Brown University, and Dartmouth College - discriminate against Asian-American applicants in their admissions processes.
The Asian American Education League held a news conference in Washington D.C. on the day of the trial to launch a campaign.

The chairman of the group, Zhao Yunqing, said at the release conference that in the past 10 years, the number of Asian applicants who meet the admission criteria of top US universities has increased exponentially, but the proportion of Asian students in these 3 top US universities has basically remained the same.
Many studies have shown that these top universities have a systematic and long-term bias against Asian applicants in their admissions process.

Zhao Yunqing introduced, according to the research of Sanders and other scholars in 2014, among the three universities, the admission rate for Asian applicants was the lowest compared to all ethnic groups.

According to data from the US Education Department, among all Ivy League schools, Brown University and Dartmouth College have the lowest admission rate for Asian students, while Yale University and Brown University have implemented de facto racial quotas for Asian applicants for over 20 years.

Zhao Yunlong told the reporter of Xinhua News Agency that after they submit their complaint, the US Education and Justice Departments can conduct an investigation and take measures to prevent these universities from continuing to discriminate against Asian applicants in their admissions process.
They also hope that the university will proactively address this issue and change its recruitment policies towards Asian students.
Currently, the three universities being sued have yet to respond.

The Asian American Education League was established in 2015, when it had previously filed a complaint with Harvard University regarding discrimination in admissions, but the US Education Department did not accept the complaint on procedural grounds.
This time, in addition to the Chinese-American community, the following ethnic groups also participated in the protest: American Indian, Korean, Japanese, and Pakistani-American educational groups.

September 2020, Mr. Li from the real estate agency learned about a factory located in Yueyang, Zhejiang Province, after multiple visits to the site, Mr. Li decided to purchase the factory.

On December 12th, Mr. Liu purchased the factory's details and ownership rights from the relative of the house owner, Ms. Lin, after negotiations. That same day, he transferred 200,000 yuan as a deposit through a bank transfer.

According to the contract, Lin (as the purchaser) signed on the "Factory Building Purchase and Sale Agreement," which states that if the buyer does not want to purchase the factory building, the deposit will be refunded to the seller, and if the seller does not want to sell the factory building, the deposit will be doubled and returned to the seller within a week. Both parties have agreed to sign the purchase and sale agreement within a week.

However, after both parties failed to reach an agreement on the main terms of the contract, such as the sales range and payment methods, the purchase contract of the house was delayed again and again.
Considering that the two parties could not reach an agreement on the contents of the contract, a few days later, Lin Xiaodong returned the 200,000 yuan deposit to Mr. Lai.
It's not easy to sell a house that is about to be completed, the down payment has been paid, and the money is ready, but the seller refused to sell, which makes Mr. Lao angry and disappointed.
Mr. Li will sue Mr. Lin to the People's Court of Yueyang City.

The court after investigation found that the two parties were unable to sign a formal contract, and it cannot be solely attributed to the defendant. Therefore, the case should not apply to the default penalty, and the defendant does not need to assume the responsibility of double returning the defaulted amount.
After a trial, the plaintiff files an appeal.
Recently, the appeals court upheld the original verdict.
"Legal Reminder: Diligence is necessary during the transaction process."

When signing a contract, as the buyer, it is important to be meticulous and careful in confirming relevant information, such as the owner of the property, whether the property is being used by someone else, and the specific time and location of delivery, to avoid disputes between the two parties when fulfilling the contract.

"Educational Thought: How to Make 'Genius' and 'Dunce' Each Get What They Deserve - Xinhua Net"

Three students from Lanzhou University wrote a letter to the school leaders, expressing their confusion about the university entrance examination, and proposed to increase the difficulty of the exam, change the exam format, and make the exam truly reflect the students' practical abilities.
Yes, for a long time, university entrance exams have been a hot topic.
At the university campus, students come from all corners of the world, with varying levels of proficiency and learning conditions, making each student's learning situation unique.
For a group with such diverse characteristics, there are different feelings, and it is difficult to avoid them.
Of course, if the test questions are all the same type, repetitive, and too simple, it will inevitably create a completely different feeling.
Students who don't study may be able to pass the exam through last-minute cramming, and they may even reach half of the expected results if they try other methods.

So, there are two types of students: those who can pass without putting in much effort and even get high grades, and those who are always on top of their work, with excellent homework, tests, and grades without any "mysterious" or unexpected improvements.

It appears that the problems faced by students at Lanzhou University during the college entrance examination are not without reason, and I believe this situation is not limited to Lanzhou University alone.
From this perspective, it is necessary to write a letter of appreciation to the 3 students who were directly involved.

It is true that many university students are aware of the tactics used to cheat on exams, such as asking teachers for extra questions, trying to manipulate the exam scope, and even bringing a small notebook to the exam hall to consult during the test. These practices are not uncommon and have been observed frequently.

In my opinion, as a teaching quality assessment guide, measuring a university's admission standards is more about the teacher's comprehensive grasp of teaching and learning, as well as the scientific problems based on this foundation.
Entering the undergraduate stage, the professional courses start to split, and many professional courses focus on basic knowledge.
Without hesitation, whether a student has a comprehensive understanding of the basic knowledge points of a subject, is a crucial aspect of college entrance exams.
The basic knowledge in this field is primarily composed of scientific foundations and basic common sense, and the scope of change is relatively limited, making it relatively fixed.
Just like what the teacher said, "20 years ago, the basic knowledge of mathematics learned in college is still being studied, and it's still a focus."
However, the fundamental knowledge points remain unchanged and do not represent a single type of exam question or repetition.

In many universities, exams are generally formed into question groups by subject matter experts, and then compiled into a test by a team of experienced teachers from the same department. The testing process is also participated in by all teachers responsible for the relevant subject, which helps to some extent to overcome the problem of repetitive questions.

However, to create an assessment plan that is truly effective, we need to come up with a set of questions that are tailored to the students' learning conditions, with a difficulty distribution that is balanced and comprehensive. This requires a thorough analysis of the students' learning progress, as well as a comprehensive understanding of the teaching situation. By doing so, we can design questions that are both challenging and dynamic, allowing us to assess the students' basic knowledge while also evaluating their ability to apply what they have learned. At the same time, we can innovate the question types to better reflect the students' learning outcomes.

The college entrance exam is the commander of higher education, and any examination will have a corresponding preparation plan for students, which will affect the effectiveness of higher education in the long run.
The school authorities highly value the advice letters from students, and have deployed a plan to address the issue throughout the school.

Require each teaching unit to organize teachers to conduct research and review courses, formulate examination questions and relevant examination systems, and strengthen supervision and inspection of examination questions and evaluation systems.

From a mechanistic perspective, addressing issues such as single-type questions and repetitive topics in college entrance exams is a crucial topic that test administrators need to face. Of course, appropriate measures need to be put in place, but the key lies in the teacher's comprehensive understanding of the teaching situation. Teachers need to go beyond just mastering the teaching content and gain a deeper understanding of the learning situation of their students. They need to eat through both the teaching and learning situations, forming a harmonious interaction between teaching and learning, and making the exams more in line with reality, thus benefiting both "students who excel" and "students who struggle."

He explained that the sandpaper used in Shaanxi is different from that in other areas, so it cannot be borrowed from other regions.
Kuala Lumpur, 6th of this month, the latest batch of anti-counterfeiting paper has arrived, which will be handed over to the printing company on the 8th for partial printing work.

"The office will send someone to Kuala Lumpur next week to buy goods, and then return to Sabah to complete the final printing stage. It is estimated that the goods will be ready for delivery to the applicant by December 20th, which is approximately 2 working days from now."

He added that Shaanxi Province has issued 24,801 birth certificates since the beginning of this year.

Education news: Beijing reduces 2016 middle school entrance examination top talent ratio - Xinhua Net.
On the 21st and 22nd of this month, the entrance examination for special talents in Beijing middle schools will be conducted unified by each district education committee.
This year, all districts in Beijing have compressed the proportion of enrollment for gifted students, and the competition for gifted students has become more intense.

According to the East City District, this year the proportion of primary school students entering junior high school with special talents in the district is not more than 5% of the total planned enrollment, with a planned enrollment of 380 students, and the admission ratio does not exceed 10% of the school's planned enrollment.
Students with talents in sports, arts, and technology, as well as those who have registered online, are eligible to take the specialized entrance examination.

For the convenience of students to participate in the examination nearby, the examination arrangements for the eastern city district will be continued from last year's arrangement, with 1 to 2 examination locations set up in each district, totaling 13 examination locations.

The examination points are divided into examination zones and each examination zone is further divided into examination rooms, and students will take the examination at the designated time in the corresponding examination room according to their examination zone.
May 23rd, the list of students who passed the online entrance examination for the district education recruitment center will be announced on the website, and students can check their results online.

"Strengthen epidemic prevention and control in border cities within 48 hours of nucleic acid test results, and establish a 'buffer zone' - Xinhua Net"

According to a notice issued by the State Council's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism on December 11, recent, individuals who have left land border ports of cities (excluding those in Hong Kong and Macau) must provide a negative nucleic acid test result within 48 hours before entering the land border port, and after arriving at the land border port, they must undergo at least one nucleic acid test.

According to the notice, the time frame for the requirements is from the date of determination of the city limits of each province, municipality, and county, and the announcement date, until March 15, 2022.
In addition, the notification also proposes that some border cities with certain conditions can conduct research on setting up epidemic prevention and control buffer zones within their jurisdictions.

The Chinese National Health and Health Commission has introduced relevant responsible persons, for some port cities, cross-border trade is the main pillar of the local economy, and there are frequent exchanges between the two sides.

Implementing differentiated management policies, transforming a single defense line into two defense lines, and achieving a "move forward" effect, compressing the spread of the epidemic and minimizing the social impact and cost of disease control to achieve the maximum effect.
Recently, there have been several domestic cluster outbreaks in our country, all of which are caused by imported cases from border cities.

According to the notice, the following issues were revealed: some epidemic monitoring and early warning were not timely, high-risk personnel were not properly managed, regular nucleic acid testing was more formal than actual, cold chain logistics were not properly managed, centralized isolation facilities were not properly managed, and the scientific and accurate handling of the epidemic was not sufficient.

The notification requires strengthening the epidemic prevention and control mechanisms in the city, completing the monitoring and early warning systems, implementing border control measures, and accelerating the completion of the shortcomings in the city's epidemic prevention and control work, with no slack or relaxation, and doing scientific and precise work in epidemic prevention and control, and tightening the external defense line.

Emphasis is placed on notifying, each coastal city must synchronize the control of the epidemic and the guarantee of basic living needs, conducting research and deploying simultaneously, publishing and broadcasting the hotline for basic living needs, periodically investigating and resolving issues related to the supply of essential goods and prices, and proactively addressing and responding to the concerns of the masses.

According to the notice, the cities, counties, and districts included in the specified coastal areas are those with open land, water, and air ports, as well as the cities, counties, and districts where the ports are located, including the cities, provinces, and autonomous regions. The specific scope will be determined by each province (municipality) based on the need for disease control and epidemic prevention and announced in a timely manner.

I have visited many milk powder factories and seen many milk powder production lines.
The actual ingredients of their milk powder are the same, with no difference whatsoever.
Why is the shelf life of a bag of food packaged in a year, while the shelf life of a can of food is two years or longer?
Why is the price difference between listening and bagging so great?
Actually, many consumers, or even mothers, think that the quality is better because the raw materials are different.
It's the same original material, but everyone thinks it's valuable just because it's expensive.
Some consumers, due to this mindset, have even said that the taste or flavor of the food after the incident was different!
Now let's talk about the reasons why you are so expensive, where are you expensive?
Why are their raw materials so different in price despite being the same?

Because the manufacturer considers that if the packaging price is too high, consumers will find it difficult to accept, which means that the manufacturer's profit is low or even non-existent, so how can the factory survive?
Therefore, they had a significant increase in their profit margins due to their pricing strategy.
Therefore, most factories are promoting in-ear designs, rather than earbuds.
There are many factories that spend tens or even hundreds of millions of dollars on advertising every year, so where does this money go?
Everyone can think about it.
As society develops, the costs of market promotion, such as: mall staff salaries, mall display fees, product gift fees, and advertising costs, continue to increase.
Therefore, each factory is constantly introducing new products, and they are all designed with a focus on user experience, with prices that are constantly rising due to the increasing market costs.
The main goal is to earn higher profits, but the cost of their raw materials will not exceed 3-4 yuan.
There is a portion of the brand that, in order to promote its products, will stop at nothing and collaborate with doctors from hospitals, earning profits of between 30-80 yuan per sale.
The relevant laws in China absolutely prohibit such operating methods, which are harmful to consumers.
It is recommended to put the milk powder in a container before buying a bag, which can save money and increase the preservation and sealability of the milk powder, and has no impact on the children.

When browsing books at the bookstore, I often feel the explosive popularity of self-help books.
The current bestselling self-help books often promote the idea of "assuming or implying that you can do something" before telling you what you need to do.
It's equivalent to saying that the most important and fundamental part of the process is crossing the "how to do it" stage.

Because of this, these books all have a common trait - either they are all-out and give it their all, or they are completely lacking in effort; either they are 100%, or they are 0%; either they climb to the top of the mountain, or they are completely lacking in energy and wait at the original place.
This "best principle" is so convincing that anyone who sees it will admit it's "absolutely correct", but 99% of people will be intimidated before they even take the first step.
This theory is pushing for a path of "you must make a firm decision and undergo a 180-degree transformation" which is the fatal weakness of many people.

For those who are stubbornly adhering to established rules, insisting on following old habits, and refusing to change, you may as well shout at them "You need to transform!" It's nothing but a futile effort, like trying to play the piano for a cow.

Most people will feel hesitant or reluctant when they hear the term "transformation" (转变), and they may take small steps or make half-hearted efforts, but they often find it difficult to maintain their resolve and make lasting changes.
Mr. Ma's famous "From Tomorrow on" sketch, which is a classic representation of the universal human nature, is the most godly performed.
The biggest problem with the "best practice" is that the threshold is too high, often exceeding the limits of ordinary people's abilities, causing most people to feel overwhelmed and give up.
Perhaps, "the principle of '次好'" is a path that can allow more ordinary people to walk on the road to relative success.

The core of "next good principle" is to "lower the threshold" - it encourages a theory of " accumulating small wins" where even if you don't achieve 100%, it's okay to achieve 1, because 1 is always greater than 0; and even if you don't climb Mount Tai, you can still climb the small sand hill in front of your house, because that's still better than standing still.
In general, doing anything is better than doing nothing.
Due to the significant reduction in thresholds, it has become more possible for ordinary people to persist, and the probability of success will also increase with persistence.
Just by following the "principle of good second" (i.e. doing things the right way the second time around), the journey will be longer but more successful.

In general, the "best principle" may appear to be a slogan that allows everyone to succeed, but in reality, it only inspires a small number of people; while the "second-best principle" can effectively inspire more people and bring more benefits to a larger number of people.

According to Xinhua Net, the hidden resource capacity of Qinghai Lake carp this year has increased by 0.71 million tons.

According to a report from the Xinhua News Agency on December 11th (reporters Liu Xiaofeng and Zhang Hongxiong), the latest monitoring results show that the fish resource reserve of Qinghai Lake has increased by 0.71 million tons this year, reaching 10.85 million tons, with an increase of over 40 times compared to the initial protection period in 2002.
The carp of Qinghai Lake is a local valuable fish species, playing a crucial role in maintaining the ecological balance and biodiversity of the "water-fish-bird" chain in the Qinghai Lake basin.

In the 1960s and 1970s, due to the impact of various factors such as large-scale fishing and eutrophication of the aquatic environment, the number of crucian carp in Lake Tai has decreased significantly, and in 2002, the total biomass of crucian carp in Lake Tai was only 2592 tons.
In 2004, the Qinghai Lake carp was listed as an endangered species in the Chinese Red Data Book.

Since 2003, Qinghai Province has implemented a fishing ban in Lake Qinghai and its main rivers and tributaries, prohibiting any unit, organization, or individual from fishing in the lake and its surrounding areas, and prohibiting the sale of dried crucian carp and its products.

At the same time, through artificial breeding and releasing of fish, as well as clearing the main inlet and outlet rivers of the Qinghai Lake and designing scientifically reasonable "fish passages," measures were continuously increased to enhance the protection capacity, and the hidden resources of the Qinghai Lake fishery were gradually increasing year by year.
As of now, the implementation of artificial breeding and release of near 1.8 million fish in Qinghai Lake has contributed more than 23% to the restoration of Qinghai Lake's grass carp resources.

The Qinghai Three Rivers Source Area is a crucial ecological barrier and water source nurturing region in China and Asia, and Lake Qinghai serves as a natural barrier and ecological function area to control the expansion of the western deserts towards the east.

To protect the ecological environment of the Three Gorges Area and the Qinghai Lake wetland, to preserve the biodiversity of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, since this year, the Qinghai Provincial Government has issued a series of notifications prohibiting fishing in the key water areas of the Yangtze River, the Yellow River, and Qinghai Lake, and has established a comprehensive ban on fishing management system for these areas.

Menstruation is uncontrollable and can last for several days within a 24-hour period. The only things that can be done are to use sanitary pads or tampons to absorb the blood and prevent it from flowing onto clothing or furniture.

The main cause of menstrual cramps is the secretion of prostaglandins, which is most effective in relieving menstrual cramps during the early stages of menstruation by taking ibuprofen, and taking ibuprofen after menstrual cramps have started is useless.
Before menstruation, due to uterine bloating and excessive progesterone release, it is easy to feel bloated.

Is foot massage causing the numbness?
Choosing the appropriate foot bath can provide excellent therapeutic benefits for foot health, and today, our editor will provide answers to this question, hoping to help friends.

As people's health awareness increases, the demand for bathing pools has been growing, and as a result, a variety of products with different price ranges have emerged in the market, from around 100 yuan to over 1,000 yuan, providing consumers with a wide range of choices.

On the surface of relevant data, while the sales of health-related home appliances such as saunas and bath tubs are explosive compared to traditional electrical appliances, there is no specialized industry standard for bath tubs, therefore there are certain safety concerns.
"Dunking your feet in electric water is simply too dangerous!"
Mr. Li told the reporter that recently, he bought a foot bath as a gift for his father's birthday, but when his father soaked his feet, he suddenly felt numbness in his soles.

Mr. Li initially thought it was the vibrating function of the foot massager that caused the problem, but he didn't realize that he had turned off the vibrating function, and his father still felt the numbness in his feet.
Mr. Li tried using an electric pen, and to his surprise, it actually lit up, revealing that the water in the foot bath was electrified.
Afterwards, he contacted the shop owner, and the owner's attitude was not bad, although he returned the bathtub, Mr. Li still felt impatient.
Because there is no clear and detailed industry regulations on aspects such as the temperature setting, target user group, and material safety guarantees for this popular bathing basin.
However, in general, bathing basins are not likely to have electricity problems, but it is possible that some products may not have been strictly inspected during the manufacturing process.
Therefore, when purchasing, choose a disassembled bathroom suite.
"Water and electricity are separated, with no safety concerns."
You can take a pen and test it at the same time.
